history.content:
Unfortunately, under US law, international students need to be actively enrolled in classes with the university (by actively, I think they mean, for academic units) for the purpose of work authorization. I don't think there is much that can be done about this.

However, what can be done is that the university could make it a case to waive the summer fees for the 1-unit CPT class. But again, given Berkeley's debt situation, this is unlikely as it would stop the sucking of free money from the international students :(

Btw, there is a petition going around regarding this and I am not sure what the current status is, but here's the link:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OPRDyWyairRyYKP8YvKjayo4U0_9yEX0zibfczWh1WI/edit

To my understanding, because I am an international student, I can only work over the summer with a CPT. Last summer I worked and enrolled in 1 unit for my CPT. Can I work during this summer for 0 units with my CPT? I don't want or need the unit (might do an extra semester and I am afraid of hitting the cap before or during my 8th semester) and the unit is super expensive over the summer. Is it possible to have the CPT and receive no academic credit for it?
history.subject: Internship over the summer and units
